caption: This video segment introduces a unique ecological environment in the Arabian Sea, a life chain composed of fishing ants and other organisms. They play important roles in this ocean, providing a significant amount of oxygen and food to the ecosystem. Their presence also attracts predators such as sharks, creating a complex ecosystem.Fishing ants play crucial roles in the Arabian Sea. They support the ecosystem by expelling oxygen and other consumable substances. They are preyed upon by a range of warm-water creatures, including sharks. Individual fishing ants are tiny, but collectively, they produce one-third of the oxygen in our atmosphere. - Warm seawater in the Arabian Sea plays a vital role. It sustains a large population of fish. Predators like sharks also inhabit this ocean. - Complexity of the ecological environment: Fishing ants and other organisms form a life chain. They depend on each other, constituting a complex ecosystem. This ocean is a vibrant environment with rich biodiversity. - Arabian Sea fishing ants are the most abundant animals on Earth. A single ant can hold up to two million tons. - Importance of ecosystems: Every species within an ecosystem has its role and interdependence. Their presence and existence are significant for the entire ecosystem. - Warm seawater in the Arabian Sea is essential for supporting the ecosystem. It provides an ample supply of oxygen and food for the ecosystem. - Balance in the ecosystem: Each species has its way of survival, competing and relying on each other. This balance is a crucial factor in maintaining ecosystem stability.
